Package de.pcmr.shop.service

Interface AddressServiceI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddressServiceImpl
    public interface AddressServiceI
    Interface of the address service. The address service manages the addresses of the customers. Addresses of an customer can be listed, created, edited and deleted.
    Author:
    Fynn Lohse

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createAddress​(AddressEntity addressEntity, java.security.Principal principal)
      Method saves new address entity for the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
      void deleteAddress​(java.lang.Long addressId, java.security.Principal principal)
      Method deletes existing address entity that belongs to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
      void editAddressIfAuthenticated​(AddressEntity addressEntity, java.security.Principal principal)
      Method to edit an existing address entity that belongs to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
      java.util.List<AddressEntity> getAddressesOfCustomer​(java.security.Principal principal)
      Method returns List of address entities that belong to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.

    • Method Detail

      • getAddressesOfCustomer

        java.util.List<AddressEntity> getAddressesOfCustomer​(java.security.Principal principal)
                                              throws NoCustomerFoundException
        Method returns List of address entities that belong to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
        Parameters:
        principal - principal of spring security context
        Returns:
        List of address entities that belong to the logged in user
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the principal

      • editAddressIfAuthenticated

        void editAddressIfAuthenticated​(AddressEntity addressEntity,
                                java.security.Principal principal)
                         throws NoCustomerFoundException,
                                AddressDoesNotBelongToUserException,
                                NoAddressFoundException
        Method to edit an existing address entity that belongs to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
        Parameters:
        addressEntity - the edited address entity
        principal - principal of spring security context
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the principal
        AddressDoesNotBelongToUserException - if the currently authenticated customer is not the owner of the address
        NoAddressFoundException - if no address could be found to the given id

      • createAddress

        void createAddress​(AddressEntity addressEntity,
                   java.security.Principal principal)
            throws NoCustomerFoundException
        Method saves new address entity for the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
        Parameters:
        addressEntity - new address entity
        principal - principal of spring security context
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the principal

      • deleteAddress

        void deleteAddress​(java.lang.Long addressId,
                   java.security.Principal principal)
            throws NoCustomerFoundException,
                   NoAddressFoundException,
                   AddressDoesNotBelongToUserException
        Method deletes existing address entity that belongs to the currently authenticated customer determined by the principal.
        Parameters:
        addressId - the id of the address to be deleted
        principal - principal of spring security context
        Throws:
        NoCustomerFoundException - if no customer could be determined by the principal
        NoAddressFoundException - if no address could be found to the given id
        AddressDoesNotBelongToUserException - if the currently authenticated customer is not the owner of the address
